data.question: What is the highest reported surface area for a phosphonate-based metalâ€“organic framework (MOF) as mentioned in the text?
What effect does the conversion of hydrophobic ester to hydrophilic hydrogen phosphonate group have on CO2 uptake?
data.answer: It approximately doubles the ambient CO2 uptake.

data.question: True or False: CALF-33-Et3 and CALF-33-Et2H have different topologies.
What is the role of phosphonate monoesters in the formation of MOFs?
data.answer: They reduce the degrees of freedom, relative to phosphonates, and facilitate the ordering of the structure and formation of crystalline solids.

data.question: How does the heat of adsorption for CO2 change from CALF-33-Et3 to CALF-33-Et2H?
data.answer: For CALF-33-Et2H, the heat of adsorption is higher, starting at 20.8 kJ mol@1 CO2 at low loadings and increasing to nearly 29.6 kJ mol@1 CO2.

data.question: True or False: The hydrolyzed frameworks resulting from the removal of the ester in phosphonate monoester-based frameworks always result in a different structure from the unhydrolyzed parent structure.
What synthetic condition variation allows for the selective hydrolysis of one PME group in an isomorphous structure?
data.answer: Slight variation of the amount of water in the preparation.

data.question: True or False: The post-synthetic conversion of CALF-33-Et3 to CALF-33-Et2H is possible under hydrothermal conditions.
What is the selectivity for CO2 over CH4 in CALF-33-Et2H?
True or False: CALF-33-Et3 has a higher performance for CO2 uptake at ambient temperatures compared to CALF-33-Et2H.
What is the significance of the ligand H3L1-Et3 in the synthesis of CALF-33?
data.answer: It is used to make a more porous structure based on a triphenylbenzene core, resulting in the formation of CALF-33-Et3 with a high surface area.

data.question: True or False: The presence of phosphonate and PME groups in the same structure indicates that the synthesis can result in variable degrees of hydrolysis.
How does the selectivity for CO2 over N2 change from CALF-33-Et3 to CALF-33-Et2H?
data.answer: The selectivity for CO2 increases from 11.5 for CALF-33-Et3 to 29.8 in CALF-33-Et2H in a 1:4 mixture of CO2 and N2.

data.question: True or False: The highest surface area materials are always the best materials for gas separation or storage.
What is the role of the triphosphonic acid analogue of L1 with Cu2+?
data.answer: It yields a poorly crystalline material with a clearly different structure compared to when using PMEs.

data.question: True or False: The mechanism of PME hydrolysis suggests that the ligand is hydrolyzed after being incorporated in the framework.
What is the significance of the CALF-33 system in the context of MOFs with phosphonate versus PME groups?
data.answer: It is the first example of isostructural MOFs with phosphonate versus PME groups, providing an opportunity to form hydrolyzed analogues of existing PME-based MOFs to improve their selectivity for CO2.

data.question: True or False: The CALF-33 system is the first to exhibit permanent porosity and an isostructural relationship with hydrolyzed PMEs.
What is the modeled surface area of CALF-33-Et3?
data.answer: Between 916 m2 g@1 and 1021 m2 g@1, depending on the orientation of the ester groups.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of CALF-33-Et2H always results in a complete hydrolysis of all PME groups.
